alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 26 at 3:49PM EDT until April 30 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Michigan... Michigamme River near Witch Lake affecting Marquette and Dickinson Counties. For the Michigamme River...including Witch Lake...elevated river levels are ongoing and are forecast to continue. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Witch Lake. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Water begins to cover County Road LG 2.6 miles northwest of M-95. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:10 PM CDT Tuesday /3:10 PM EDT Tuesday/ the stage was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...River levels are expected to continue to rise Tuesday night and reach flood stage around Wednesday evening. - Action stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM CDT /1100 PM EDT/.
